page.title: 01METHWOLD FENS part 1
page.content: The area covered by the survey lies either side of the Feltwell - Southery Road and is locally known as Poppylot Road. The whole district has, in the last fifteen to twenty years been purchased by institutions (Insurance and pension funds) and farmed by farmers on a rental or partnership basis. Both farmers and labourers live in surrounding villages The area lying between Poppylot Farm and Bourne Farm has been owned by Norfolk County Council since l914/20, and is farmed in units of about 100 acres by men who each have a bungalow and a large barn plus smaller buildings erected by themselves. The whole area is peat over clay or sand; the peat being about 4 feet deep to the north of the road and 6" to 1foot deep south of the road.
